channel.title: Computing at Norton Community Primary School on Computing
channel.description: Recent content in Computing at Norton Community Primary School on Computing

item.title: Resources
item.description: How to find what you need on the website.

item.title: Logo Commands
item.description: Here are all the logo commands you can see in the panel on the right.

item.title: Introduction
item.description: The rules of the game are simple. What’s amazing is the complex effects they create.

item.title: Start a Spreadsheet
item.description: To start using a spreadsheet, log in to Purple Mash and launch 2Calculate in formula mode.

item.title: Marker Skills
item.description: Use Drawing Tools to create and modify markers. We are going to put a marker on the town of Tenby so that we can see it at any scale.

item.title: Setup
item.description: At the start of each academic year, there are a number of setup processes to run through.

item.title: Calculate a Total
item.description: Again, log in to Purple Mash and launch 2Calculate in formula mode.

item.title: More Markers
item.description: Practise your marker skills by finding and adding markers to two more places.

item.title: Games
item.description: For individual pratice, there are spelling games and word games.

item.title: Let's Automate It
item.description: There are lots of computer programs that play the Game of Life.

item.title: Try It Out
item.description: On a white board or piece of paper, draw two grids (at least 3x3) and mark some cells alive.

item.title: Update a Total
item.description: Log in to Purple Mash and open your PE Kit spreadsheet from last lesson.

item.title: Place Skills
item.description: Learn to recognise how different places are shown on the map.

item.title: Monitoring
item.description: How do you keep tabs on the little bezzlers?

item.title: Let's Be Systematic
item.description: We’ve tried evolving some random soups and we have seen a few still life patterns and some oscillator patterns.

item.title: Advanced Totals
item.description: In this session, we are going to use even more formulas.

item.title: Match Mystery
item.description: Now we have the map view of each settlement, can we match them to photos taken at each location?

item.title: Your Turn
item.description: Now you know how to make 2Calculate Spreadsheets, have a go at solving some problems.

item.title: Load A Map
item.description: Load a map with markers on the three settlements we are looking at.

item.title: Photo Quest
item.description: When you take a picture on your phone, the geophysical location of the image is stored along with the picture.

item.title: Measurement Skills
item.description: Our three settlements are clearly quite different. Located East, South and West around the UK coastline, they are also different sizes.

item.title: History Mystery
item.description: If we could look at maps from the past, what might be different?

item.title: Size Mystery
item.description: We have seen that Brighton is far bigger than both Tenby and Happisburgh. Why did it grow so much bigger?

item.title: Yorkshire Coast
item.description: There are towns on our Yorkshire coast that are like those we’ve been studying.

item.title: Try Vue.js
item.description: This page shows that Vue can be loaded and interact with Hugo templates and shortcodes.
